title.raw: 《孝武本紀》 Annals of the Xiaowu Emperor

sentences.zh: 孝武皇帝者，孝景中子也。

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaowu was Emperor Xiaojing's middle son.

sentences.zh: 母曰王太后。

translations.literal: Mother called Empress Dowager Wang.

sentences.zh: 孝景四年，以皇子為膠東王。

translations.literal: Xiaojing fourth year, made imperial son King of Jiaodong.

sentences.zh: 孝景七年，栗太子廢為臨江王，以膠東王為太子。

translations.literal: Xiaojing seventh year, Crown Prince Li deposed to become King of Linjiang, King of Jiaodong made crown prince.

sentences.zh: 孝景十六年崩，太子即位，為孝武皇帝。

translations.literal: Xiaojing sixteenth year collapsed, crown prince ascended throne as Emperor Xiaowu.

sentences.zh: 孝武皇帝初即位，尤敬鬼神之祀。

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaowu first ascended throne, especially revered ghosts spirits sacrifices.

Emperor Xiaowu was Emperor Xiaojing's middle son. His mother was called Empress Dowager Wang. In Emperor Xiaojing's fourth year, he was made King of Jiaodong as an imperial son. In Emperor Xiaojing's seventh year, Crown Prince Li was deposed to become King of Linjiang, and the King of Jiaodong was made Crown Prince. Emperor Xiaojing collapsed in the sixteenth year. The Crown Prince ascended the throne and became Emperor Xiaowu. When Emperor Xiaowu first ascended the throne, he especially respected the sacrifices to ghosts and spirits.

sentences.zh: 元年，漢興已六十餘歲矣，天下乂安，薦紳之屬皆望天子封禪改正度也。

translations.literal: First year, Han arisen already sixty remaining years, all under Heaven peaceful secure, scholars officials all hoped Son of Heaven would perform Feng Shan sacrifices reform calendar measurements.

sentences.zh: 而上鄉儒術，招賢良，趙綰、王臧等以文學為公卿，欲議古立明堂城南，以朝諸侯。

translations.literal: And emperor favored Confucian learning, recruited worthy good men, Zhao Wan, Wang Zang etc. through literature became high ministers, wished to discuss antiquity establish Mingtang south of capital to receive feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 草巡狩封禪改歷服色事未就。

translations.literal: Planned imperial tours Feng Shan sacrifices change calendar clothing colors matters not completed.

sentences.zh: 會竇太后治黃老言，不好儒術，使人微得趙綰等姦利事，召案綰、臧，綰、臧自殺，諸所興為者皆廢。

translations.literal: Happened Empress Dowager Dou practiced Huang-Lao teachings disliked Confucian learning, sent people secretly obtained Zhao Wan etc. corrupt profiteering matters, summoned investigated Wan Zang, Wan Zang committed suicide, all initiated things abolished.

In the first year, the Han had risen already over sixty years. The realm was pacified and peaceful. All the scholar-officials hoped the Son of Heaven would perform the fengshan ceremony and correct the calendar measures. The emperor favored Confucian arts and recruited the worthy and good. Zhao Wan, Wang Zang, and others became ministers through literature. They wished to discuss the ancient practice of establishing a Bright Hall south of the city to receive the feudal lords. The matters of drafting imperial tours, fengshan ceremonies, changing the calendar, and clothing colors were not completed. Empress Dowager Dou governed with Huang-Lao teachings and did not like Confucian arts. She had someone secretly obtain evidence of Zhao Wan and others' illicit profits, summoned and investigated Wan and Zang. Wan and Zang committed suicide. All the things they had promoted were abolished.

sentences.zh: 後六年，竇太后崩。

translations.literal: After six years, Empress Dowager Dou collapsed.

sentences.zh: 其明年，上徵文學之士公孫弘等。

translations.literal: Next year, emperor summoned literary scholars Gongsun Hong etc.
After six years, Empress Dowager Dou collapsed. The next year, the emperor summoned scholars of literature like Gongsun Hong.

sentences.zh: 明年，上初至雍，郊見五畤。

translations.literal: Next year, emperor first went to Yong, performed suburban sacrifice to Five Altar sites.

sentences.zh: 後常三歲一郊。

translations.literal: Afterwards regularly three years one suburban sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 是時上求神君，捨之上林中蹄氏觀。

translations.literal: This time emperor sought Divine Lord, housed him in Tiji Pavilion in Shanglin Park.

sentences.zh: 神君者，長陵女子，以子死悲哀，故見神於先後宛若。

translations.literal: Divine Lord was Changling woman, because child died grieved, therefore appeared as spirit to husband Yanruo.

sentences.zh: 宛若祠之其室，民多往祠。

translations.literal: Yanruo sacrificed to her in his chamber, people often went to sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 平原君往祠，其後子孫以尊顯。

translations.literal: Lord of Pingyuan went to sacrifice, afterwards descendants became honored eminent.

sentences.zh: 及武帝即位，則厚禮置祠之內中，聞其言，不見其人云。

translations.literal: When Emperor Wu ascended throne, then treated with great ceremony placed shrine in inner palace, heard her words, did not see her person, it is said.

The next year, the emperor first arrived at Yong and performed suburban audience at the five altars. Afterwards, he regularly performed suburban sacrifices every three years. At this time, the emperor sought the divine lord and lodged at the Ti clan observation in the middle of Shanglin. The divine lord was a woman from Changling. Because her son died and she was sorrowful, she therefore saw a spirit that resembled her deceased husband Wan Ruo. Wan Ruo sacrificed to her in her room. Many people went to sacrifice there. The Lord of Pingyuan went to sacrifice there. His later descendants became honored and illustrious. When Emperor Wu ascended the throne, he then placed her with thick ritual in the inner palace for sacrifice. One heard her words but did not see her person, it is said.

sentences.zh: 是時而李少君亦以祠灶、穀道、卻老方見上，上尊之。

translations.literal: This time Li Shaojun also with stove sacrifice, grain immortality, ward off old age methods appeared before emperor, emperor honored him.

sentences.zh: 少君者，故深澤侯入以主方。

translations.literal: Shaojun was former Marquis of Shenze's son who entered as master of recipes.

sentences.zh: 匿其年及所生長，常自謂七十，能使物，卻老。

translations.literal: Concealed his age and birthplace, constantly claimed seventy, could manipulate things, ward off old age.

sentences.zh: 其游以方遍諸侯。

translations.literal: His travels with recipes went throughout feudal lords.

translations.literal: Had no wife children.

sentences.zh: 人聞其能使物及不死，更饋遺之，常餘金錢帛衣食。

translations.literal: People heard his ability to manipulate things and immortality, moreover gave him gifts, constantly had surplus gold money silk clothing food.

sentences.zh: 人皆以為不治產業而饒給，又不知其何所人，愈信，爭事之。

translations.literal: People all thought did not manage property but wealthy, moreover did not know where income came from, became even more believing, competed to serve him.

sentences.zh: 少君資好方，善為巧發奇中。

translations.literal: Shaojun had natural talent for recipes, skilled at making clever discoveries miraculously hit mark.

sentences.zh: 嘗從武安侯飲，坐中有年九十餘老人，少君乃言與其大父游射處，老人為兒時從其大父行，識其處，一坐盡驚。

translations.literal: Once followed Marquis of Wuan drinking, seats had old man ninety remaining years, Shaojun then spoke of places roamed hunted with his grandfather, old man as child followed his grandfather went, recognized places, whole gathering completely astonished.

sentences.zh: 少君見上，上有故銅器，問少君。

translations.literal: Shaojun appeared before emperor, emperor had old bronze vessel, asked Shaojun.

sentences.zh: 少君曰：「此器齊桓公十年陳於柏寢。」

translations.literal: Shaojun said: "This vessel Duke Huan of Qi tenth year displayed in Cypress Chamber."

sentences.zh: 已而案其刻，果齊桓公器。

translations.literal: Afterwards examined its inscriptions, indeed Duke Huan of Qi's vessel.

sentences.zh: 一宮盡駭，以少君為神，數百歲人也。

translations.literal: Whole palace completely astonished, took Shaojun as god, several hundred years person.

At this time, Li Shaogun also appeared before the emperor with methods of sacrificing to the stove, grain immortality, and dispelling old age. The emperor honored him. Shaogun was a person from the former Marquis of Shenze who came with the main methods. He concealed his age and where he grew up. He often claimed to be seventy, able to make things happen and dispel old age. His travels with methods reached everywhere among the feudal lords. He had no wife or children. People heard of his ability to make things happen and achieve immortality. They moreover fed and sent him gifts, often leaving surplus gold, money, silks, clothing, and food. People all considered that he did not manage estates yet had abundant supply, and moreover did not know where his income came from. They believed even more and contended to serve him. Shaogun was naturally good at methods and skilled at clever revelations that marveled and hit the mark. Once he followed the Marquis of Wuan drinking. In the seats there was an old man over ninety years. Shaogun then spoke of places where he had toured and shot with his grandfather. The old man, when he was a child, had followed his grandfather and gone there, and recognized those places. The entire gathering was astonished. Shaogun saw the emperor. The emperor had an old bronze vessel and asked Shaogun about it. Shaogun said: 'This vessel was displayed by Duke Huan of Qi in his tenth year at the Bo resting place.' Then they examined its inscriptions, and indeed it was a vessel of Duke Huan of Qi. The whole palace was startled, took Shaojun as a spirit, a several hundred years person also.

sentences.zh: 少君言於上曰：「祠灶則致物，致物而丹沙可化為黃金，黃金成以為飲食器則益壽，益壽而海中蓬萊僊者可見，見之以封禪則不死，黃帝是也。

translations.literal: I once traveled sea, saw An Qisheng, fed me dates large as melons.

translations.literal: An Qisheng immortal, communicates Penglai, accords then appears to people, not accords then hides."

sentences.zh: 於是天子始親祠灶，而遣方士入海求蓬萊安期生之屬，而事化丹沙諸藥齊為黃金矣。

translations.literal: Thereupon Son of Heaven began personally sacrificing to stove, dispatched alchemists into sea seek Penglai An Qisheng and like, undertook transforming cinnabar various medicines into gold.

Shaojun spoke to the emperor said: 'Sacrifice stove then bring things. Bring things and cinnabar sand can transform into yellow gold. Yellow gold completed as food and drink vessels then increase longevity. Increase longevity and sea middle Penglai immortals can be seen. Seen with feng shan then not die. Yellow Emperor is this.' Minister once toured above the sea, saw An Qisheng, fed minister dates, big as melon. An Qisheng is an immortal person, connects to Penglai middle, when harmonious then sees people, when not harmonious then hides.' Thereupon the Son of Heaven began personally sacrificing to the stove, yet sent fangshi who entered the sea and sought Penglai and An Qisheng's kind, yet undertook transforming cinnabar sand and various medicines together into yellow gold.

sentences.zh: 居久之，李少君病死。

translations.literal: After long time, Li Shaojun fell ill died.

sentences.zh: 天子以為化去不死也，而使黃錘史寬舒受其方。

translations.literal: Emperor thought transformed gone immortal, sent Huang Chuoshi Kuanshu receive his recipes.

sentences.zh: 求蓬萊安期生莫能得，而海上燕齊怪迂之方士多相效，更言神事矣。

translations.literal: Seeking Penglai An Qisheng could not obtain, coastal Yan Qi strange impractical alchemists many imitated each other, moreover spoke divine matters.

Stayed a long time, Li Shaojun illness died. The Son of Heaven considered that he had transformed and departed, achieving immortality. He made the Huangchui Scribe Kuanshu receive his methods. He sought Penglai and An Qisheng but none could be obtained. Yet the coastal Yan and Qi strange and far-fetched method masters mostly imitated each other, moreover speaking of divine matters.

sentences.zh: 亳人薄誘忌奏祠泰一方，曰：「天神貴者泰一，泰一佐曰五帝。

translations.literal: Man from Bo, Bo Youji memorialized sacrifice to Taiyi method, said: "Heavenly deity most honored Taiyi, Taiyi assistants called Five Emperors.

sentences.zh: 古者天子以春秋祭泰一東南郊，用太牢具，七日，為壇開八通之鬼道。」

translations.literal: Anciently Son of Heaven in spring autumn sacrificed Taiyi southeastern suburbs, used great sacrificial animals, seven days, made altar opened eight paths ghosts."

sentences.zh: 於是天子令太祝立其祠長安東南郊，常奉祠如忌方。

translations.literal: Thereupon Son of Heaven ordered Grand Invocator establish shrine Chang'an southeastern suburbs, regularly performed sacrifices like Youji's method.

sentences.zh: 其後人有上書，言「古者天子三年一用太牢具祠神三一：天一，地一，泰一」。

translations.literal: Afterwards someone submitted memorial, said "Anciently Son of Heaven three years once used great sacrificial animals sacrificed three supreme ones: Tianyi, Diyi, Taiyi."

sentences.zh: 天子許之，令太祝領祠之忌泰一壇上，如其方。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven approved it, ordered Grand Invocator lead sacrifices to them on Youji's Taiyi altar, according to that method.

sentences.zh: 後人復有上書，言「古者天子常以春秋解祠，祠黃帝用一梟破鏡；

translations.literal: Later someone else submitted memorial, said "Anciently Son of Heaven regularly in spring autumn performed exorcism sacrifice, sacrificed Yellow Emperor used one owl broken mirror;

sentences.zh: 冥羊用羊；

translations.literal: Dark Sheep uses sheep;

sentences.zh: 祠馬行用一青牡馬；

translations.literal: Sacrificing Horse Way uses one blue stallion;

sentences.zh: 泰一、皋山山君、地長用牛；

translations.literal: Taiyi, Gaoshan Mountain Lord, Earth Elder use oxen;

sentences.zh: 武夷君用乾魚；

translations.literal: Wuyi Lord uses dried fish;

sentences.zh: 陰陽使者以一牛」。

translations.literal: Yin Yang messengers with one ox."

sentences.zh: 令祠官領之如其方，而祠於忌泰一壇旁。

translations.literal: Ordered sacrificial officials lead them like that method, sacrificed beside Youji's Taiyi altar.

The Bo person Bo Youji memorialized a method for sacrificing to Taiyi, saying: 'Among heaven's spirits, the noble one is Taiyi. Taiyi's assistants are called the Five Emperors.' The ancient Son of Heaven sacrificed to Taiyi in the southeast suburbs during spring and autumn, using complete great sacrificial animals, for seven days, making an altar that opened the eight directions for the ghost paths.' Thereupon the Son of Heaven commanded the Grand Invocator to establish his sacrifice in the southeast suburbs of Chang'an, constantly conducting the sacrifice according to Youji's method. Afterward, someone memorialized a book saying: 'The ancient Son of Heaven once every three years used complete great sacrificial animals to sacrifice to the three spirits: Heaven One, Earth One, Taiyi One.' The Son of Heaven permitted it and commanded the Grand Invocator to lead the sacrifice above Youji's Taiyi altar, according to his method. Later people again had submit memorial, spoke 'Ancient ones Son of Heaven often with spring autumn solved sacrifices, sacrificed Yellow Emperor used one xiao broken mirror; Mingyang used sheep; Sacrificed Maxing used one blue stallion; Taiyi, Gaoshan mountain lord, earth long used cattle; The Lord of Wuyi used dried fish; The yin yang envoys used one ox.' He commanded the sacrifice officials to lead it according to his method, and sacrifice at the side of Youji's Taiyi altar.

sentences.zh: 其後，天子苑有白鹿，以其皮為幣，以發瑞應，造白金焉。

translations.literal: Afterwards, emperor's park had white deer, used its hide for currency, to issue auspicious responses, made white gold.
Afterward, the Son of Heaven's park had a white deer. He made currency from its hide to issue auspicious responses, and made white gold there.

sentences.zh: 其明年，郊雍，獲一角獸，若麃然。

translations.literal: Next year, performed suburban sacrifice at Yong, obtained one-horned beast, like muntjac.

sentences.zh: 有司曰：「陛下肅祗郊祀，上帝報享，錫一角獸，蓋麟云。」

translations.literal: Officials said: "Your Majesty reverently performed suburban sacrifice, Supreme Deity responded with favor, bestowed one-horned beast, probably qilin."

sentences.zh: 於是以薦五畤，畤加一牛以燎。

translations.literal: Thereupon presented to Five Altars, each altar added one ox for burnt offering.

sentences.zh: 賜諸侯白金，以風符應合于天地。

translations.literal: Granted white gold to feudal lords, to demonstrate tally corresponded harmonized with Heaven Earth.

The next year, at the suburban sacrifice in Yong, they obtained a one-horned beast, like a mi deer. The officials said: 'Your Majesty solemnly and respectfully performed the suburban sacrifice. The Supreme Deity responded and enjoyed it, bestowing a one-horned beast - probably a qilin.' Thereupon they offered it to the five altars, with each altar adding one ox for burning. He granted the feudal lords white gold, to make the talismans respond and unite with heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 於是濟北王以為天子且封禪，乃上書獻泰山及其旁邑。

translations.literal: Thereupon King of Jibei thought Son of Heaven about to perform Feng Shan, submitted memorial offered Mount Tai and neighboring towns.

sentences.zh: 天子受之，更以他縣償之。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven accepted it, moreover compensated with other counties.

sentences.zh: 常山王有罪，遷，天子封其弟於真定，以續先王祀，而以常山為郡。

translations.literal: King of Changshan committed crime, moved, Son of Heaven enfeoffed his younger brother at Zhending, to continue previous king's sacrifices, made Changshan commandery.

sentences.zh: 然後五嶽皆在天子之郡。

translations.literal: Then Five Sacred Peaks all in Son of Heaven's commanderies.

Thereupon the King of Jibei considered that the Son of Heaven was about to perform the fengshan ceremony, so he memorialized and offered Taishan and its neighboring cities. The Son of Heaven accepted it, and moreover compensated him with other counties. The King of Changshan had a crime and was banished. The Son of Heaven enfeoffed his younger brother at Zhending to continue the previous king's sacrifices, and made Changshan into a commandery. Then all five peaks were in the Son of Heaven's commanderies.

sentences.zh: 其明年，齊人少翁以鬼神方見上。

translations.literal: Next year, man from Qi Shaojun with ghosts spirits methods appeared before emperor.

sentences.zh: 上有所幸王夫人，夫人卒，少翁以方術蓋夜致王夫人及灶鬼之貌云，天子自帷中望見焉。

translations.literal: Emperor favored Lady Wang, lady died, Shaojun used recipes secretly at night brought Lady Wang and stove ghost's appearance, it is said, Son of Heaven from within curtains saw them.

sentences.zh: 於是乃拜少翁為文成將軍，賞賜甚多，以客禮禮之。

translations.literal: Thereupon appointed Shaojun as General Wencheng, bestowed rewards very many, treated with guest rituals.

sentences.zh: 文成言曰：「上即欲與神通，宮室被服不象神，神物不至。」

translations.literal: Wencheng said: "Emperor wishes communicate with spirits, palace chambers clothing do not resemble gods, divine things will not come."

sentences.zh: 乃作畫雲氣車，及各以勝日駕車辟惡鬼。

translations.literal: Made painted cloud-qi chariots, each used victory days drove chariots warded off evil spirits.

sentences.zh: 又作甘泉宮，中為臺室，畫天、地、泰一諸神，而置祭具以致天神。

translations.literal: Also built Ganquan Palace, center made terrace chambers, painted Heaven Earth Taiyi various gods, placed sacrificial implements to summon heavenly gods.

sentences.zh: 居歲餘，其方益衰，神不至。

translations.literal: After residing over year, his recipes increasingly declined, spirits did not come.

sentences.zh: 乃為帛書以飯牛，詳弗知也，言此牛腹中有奇。

translations.literal: Made silk book to feed ox, pretended not to know, said this ox belly had something strange.

sentences.zh: 殺而視之，得書，書言其怪，天子疑之。

translations.literal: Killed examined it, obtained book, book spoke of its strangeness, Son of Heaven doubted it.

sentences.zh: 有識其手書，問之人，果（為）［偽］書。

translations.literal: Someone recognized his handwriting, questioned person, indeed forged book.

sentences.zh: 於是誅文成將軍而隱之。

translations.literal: Thereupon executed General Wencheng but concealed it.

The next year, the Qi person Shao Weng appeared before the emperor with ghost and spirit methods. The emperor had favored Lady Wang. The lady had died. Shao Weng with his method arts overnight brought the appearance of Lady Wang and the stove ghost, it is said. The Son of Heaven gazed and saw them from within the curtain. Thereupon then appointed Shao Weng as Wencheng general, rewards very many, treated him with guest ritual. Wencheng spoke said: 'Emperor immediately wants to connect with spirits, palaces and clothing do not resemble spirits, spirit things will not arrive.' Then made painted cloud qi carriage, and each with victory day drove carriage to ward off evil ghosts. Again made Ganquan palace, middle made platform rooms, painted heaven, earth, Taiyi and various spirits, yet placed sacrifice implements to bring heaven spirits. Stayed more than a year, their methods increasingly declined, spirits did not arrive. He then made a silk book and fed it to the ox, pretending not to know, saying that this ox's belly had a marvel. They killed and inspected it, obtained the book, the book spoke of its marvel. The Son of Heaven doubted it. Someone recognized his handwriting and asked people about it. Indeed it was a false book. Thereupon he executed the General of Wencheng but concealed it.

sentences.zh: 其後則又作柏梁、銅柱、承露僊人掌之屬矣。

translations.literal: Afterwards then also made Cypress Beam, Bronze Pillar, Dew-Catching Immortal figures and like.
Afterward, he then moreover made the Cypress Beam, Copper Pillar, Dew Receiving Immortal Person, and palm and such things.

sentences.zh: 文成死明年，天子病鼎湖甚，巫醫無所不致，（至）不愈。

translations.literal: Year after Wencheng died, Son of Heaven gravely ill at Dinghu, witches physicians employed without limit, did not recover.

sentences.zh: 游水發根乃言曰：「上郡有巫，病而鬼下之。」

translations.literal: You Shui Fagen then said: "Shangjun has witch, when ill spirits descend upon her."

sentences.zh: 上召置祠之甘泉。

translations.literal: Emperor summoned placed shrine at Ganquan.

sentences.zh: 及病，使人問神君。

translations.literal: When ill, sent people asked Divine Lord.

sentences.zh: 神君言曰：「天子毋憂病。

translations.literal: Divine Lord said: "Son of Heaven need not worry illness.

sentences.zh: 病少愈，彊與我會甘泉。」

translations.literal: Illness slightly improves, force yourself meet with me at Ganquan."

sentences.zh: 於是病愈，遂幸甘泉，病良已。

translations.literal: Thereupon illness cured, consequently visited Ganquan, illness truly gone.

sentences.zh: 大赦天下，置壽宮神君。

translations.literal: Granted great amnesty all under Heaven, established Shou Palace Divine Lord.

sentences.zh: 神君最貴者（大夫）［太一］，其佐曰大禁、司命之屬，皆從之。

translations.literal: Divine Lord most honored Taiyi, his assistants called Great Prohibition, Director of Fate and like, all followed him.

sentences.zh: 非可得見，聞其音，與人言等。

translations.literal: Could not be seen, heard their sounds, equal to human speech.

sentences.zh: 時去時來，來則風肅然也。

translations.literal: Sometimes left sometimes came, came then wind solemn.

sentences.zh: 居室帷中。

translations.literal: Dwelled chamber curtains within.

sentences.zh: 時晝言，然常以夜。

translations.literal: Sometimes spoke daytime, but usually night.

sentences.zh: 天子祓，然後入。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven purified himself, then entered.

sentences.zh: 因巫為主人，關飲食。

translations.literal: Relied on shamaness as host, oversaw food drink.

sentences.zh: 所欲者言行下。

translations.literal: What desired spoke carried out.

sentences.zh: 又置壽宮、北宮，張羽旗，設供具，以禮神君。

translations.literal: Also established Shou Palace, North Palace, spread feather banners, set up sacrificial implements, to honor Divine Lord.

sentences.zh: 神君所言，上使人受書其言，命之曰「畫法」。

translations.literal: What Divine Lord said, emperor had people receive write down her words, named "Portrait Methods."

sentences.zh: 其所語，世俗之所知也，毋絕殊者，而天子獨喜。

translations.literal: What spoke of, world commonly knew, nothing extraordinary, but Son of Heaven alone pleased.

sentences.zh: 其事祕，世莫知也。

translations.literal: Her affairs secret, world did not know.

The year after Wencheng died, the Son of Heaven became very ill at Dinghu. Witch doctors were brought without limit, but he was not healed. You Shui Fagen then spoke and said: 'The Shang commandery has a witch. He was ill but a spirit descended upon him.' The emperor summoned and placed sacrifice at Ganquan.
